alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 16 at 10:12AM EST until December 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday morning, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two and a half to three feet above normal. High tide at Coltons Point is at 6:14 PM Sunday evening and 6:50 AM Monday. High Tide at Piney Point is 5:38 PM Sunday evening and 6:14 AM Monday. High tide at Point Lookout is at 4:55 PM Sunday afternoon and 5:16 AM Monday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 16/04 AM 1.5 -0.1 0.3 0.5 None 16/04 PM 2.0 0.4 0.6 0.5 None 17/05 AM 2.0 0.4 0.8 1.0 None 17/06 PM 3.0 1.4 1.6 2.0 Minor 18/05 AM 3.8 2.2 2.6 3.0 Moderate 18/05 PM 2.8 1.2 1.6 2.0 None &&
